question: What are you retarded or something?! Why don't you look where you're going?

What are you doing here?

answer: In bed I guess... Oh, God ... Guess what, I bought a dog.

answer: Well, I'll be here -- I always like what you do. Wait! I've got something for you.

answer: No... It's a song Lisa and Wendy wrote.

question: Why didn't they give it to me themselves?
answer: Well, I liked it and wanted to listen to it. They told me to give it to you when I was done.

question: One, two, three, kick! One, two, three, kick! Four, five...Oh, Lord. Cut! Cut! You ladies don't seem to realize how valuable my time is. You're going to make my boys look bad. The bitches are okay, but we need something more exciting-
answer: You're right. We could be doing much better. Any ideas?

question: That powder fine babe we saw last night.
answer: Oooh, yeee! -- Why don't we find out who she is?

question: I already know that. Jill gave me everything last night. Whawhak!
answer: Then what are we waiting for? Let's go!

question: No, no -- that ain't classy enough. I want the bitch to come to me -- I'm the only star in this town. Jerome! Lo-rd..! Such nastiness. Hee, hee -- Let's break. Jerome, this car -- it's...it's lacking something. What do you think?
I got it! The hubcaps. We need something sweeter.
answer: I think I know what it needs.

question: Yeah ... I know what these need. The girl has expensive tastes. I wonder if she can sing.
answer: As fine as she is...she doesn't have to know how to sing.

question: I know that's right. Hey -- watch it now. I want you to stay out of the set tonight. I want you to work the floor.
I want to know when that sweet thing shows up. You stay by the door, you see her, you come get me, cool?
answer: Cool. I come get you -- let you know the girl's there.

question: Well, not if I'm with my other babes. That wouldn't be cool. I don't want to break their hearts, and you know how I feel abouy that. So we ought to have like, a signal.
Okay. What's the password?
Got what?

-- Hold it now. Slow down. The babe walks in and you see her.
You come get me.
And I'll probably have a couple little sexies on the stand-by, and we don't want to upset them, do we? So you just glide by me and say...what?
The password is okay?
Dammit! Say the password.
Say the password, sperm breath!
That's what I'm asking you!
The password is it?
It! You just said so!
answer: The password isn't it! The password is--

question: -- What?
1 got it?

answer: Hey, wait! Give it back to mel

question: You can have it back later.

Female or male?
You're lying. I can tell just by your reaction that you're lying. So you gave it to me -- it's not yours anymore.
Let's go for a ride.
answer: It's pretty. My psychic told rne I was going to be famous.

question: How much did that cost you?
answer: Fifty bucks. It was a good investment. No seriously -- My psychic did tell me. I was in a play once.

question: Oh, yeah -- what did you play?
answer: Isadora Duncan... That means I can sing and dance. Want to help me?

question: Nope.

Well, for starters ycu have to purify yourself in the waters of Lake Minnetonka.
You have to purify yourself in Lake Minnetonka. Hey, wait a minute! Thats--

That ain't Lake Minnetonka.
answer: You bastard. I don't believe it. How could you do that to me?! Damn you -- I'll kill you. You prick! Are you sick?! Is this some kind of ritual -- getting your kicks! How many girls have you done this to? Bastard!

question: I'm paying ... see? Keep the change.
answer: The manager wants to see you.

Hi -- I really like your club.
What time is it?
Oh, that's a really nice watch. Very pretty. You look like a guy I used to go out with -- he was a lot older, but I like older men.
I just came off a Broadway play. My grandmother got sick.
No, in New York ... But, huh, I have a sister here, lives in Saint ... huh
Amazing.
answer: Ye-es. What do you want to do? You don't want to be a waitress do you?

question: No ... no...Actually I was thinking more in the way of the stage.
Theatre?
answer: Dinner, then the theatre, my sweets.

question: Hi ya, Prince. I heard through the grapevine you had a new tune written by two great girls. By chance did you hear it?
answer: I knew it -- he didn't listen to it. He probably dropped it under his bike and rolled over it.

question: Wow! Okay...you think about this. I'm going to be real honest with you. You're really being full of shit.
answer: Forget about it, Wendy. Let's get out of here--

question: Every time we give you a song, you say you're going to use it, but you never do. You always think that we're doing something behind your back. You're just being paranoid as usual.
Honey -- don't you ever try and breastfeed no baby now. Never mind ...
What?
What??
Ye-es What time is it? So, right.
answer: Vanity, I'd like you to meet Morris E. Day.

question: Hold it now -- just leave the 'E' alone.
The pleasure's all mine.
I think you know that. Jerome! Huh, keep the change-- Get my change, will ya? Oh, Lord...either somebody put something in my drink, or you are the finest I've seen in ages.
answer: Excuse me, what did you say?

question: Huh...you look nice tonight. It's rare that I out my cards on the table when it comes to meeting younq ladies, but ... I'm going to make you love me.
Just as sure as my Stacy Adams are shiny. He doesn't like girls.
Thanks.
We have to go to your place.
I want to show you something.
Why -- is there someone there?
answer: Why do you always think there's somebody else?

question: Let's go.
answer: Yeah -- but we're not going to my place. That was a grand entrance. Where am I? So -- friends of yours?

question: Yeah -- the freak show.
C'mon.
answer: If you think you scared me, you didn't.

question: Oh, yeah ...
answer: Who's the lucky girl? Sounds like she was having a good time.

question: She's crying -- it's backwards. It makes me sad when I hear it. It sorta sounds like she's laughing, doesn't it?
answer: So what did you do to her? Do you always treat your women like that?

question: I don't have anybody right now.
Stop.
You shit! What the hell are you doing here?
answer: Shh! Shh! Shh! oh, Lord help me outta here. Hee, hee -- I know you wouldn't want to spend the whole night with ol' pencil dick.

question: Your nose alright?
answer: My nose is fine, I'm just wondering if I fucked my shoes up... C'mon ...

question: Ye-es! For dessert!! Whawhak! Thank you. Here you are, dear. Jerome, uh, get your pad and pencil, I think it's gonna be kinda right. Y'know...they say that saliva is an aphrodisiac. You look so lovely tonight.
Probably you'd look better under exotic...red...liqhts. I wish you could see my home. It's...it's so exciting. In my bedroom, I have a brass waterbed ...
I have an Italian cook, Gino Izogochograchi, or something like that. It's funny...your eyes -- when you stare at me like that, it causes my stomach to qui- quiver. Oh, Lord... Do you like diamonds?
Yeah ...?
I know it's rather masculine, but -- try this one on.
My God, darling it fits. You must have strong hands, but -- they're so soft...like oils in my bubble bath. Damn ... Darling...?

I'm not usually so forward, but -- would you like to make love to me? I can make it so nice ... Do you know what is meant by the words, huh, I hate to use them, they're so harsh, so American...I mean, and yet on the other hand, they're exciting words. The words... ...chili sauce. Oh, Lord. You know, I haven't made love in so long, but with you I know it would be just like riding a bike. I'd remember everything I've ever learned. Baby, if the kid can't make you come, nobody can.
Yeah...?
Over there -- that's where I live.
Yes.
That one, right there, see? On the 14th floor.
Oh, it's great. Real pretty. Big open rooms, balconies, fireplace -- the works.
Hey, wait! C'mon! Okay -- where are you taking me?
answer: Home. You and me are a lot alike.- I like that. So, I'd like to help you out. I think I have something you may be interested, in.

question: Oh yeah -- what?
answer: A little song and dance. That is, if you can sing and dance.

question: Morris...? I had a feeling it was you -- I knew it! It's amazing -- I could tell it was you.
Took a cab.
answer: Oh yeah? Where'd you get that?

question: I adore camisoles.
God, this is beautiful. It reminds me of where I grew up. My father used to ...
Nothing...it's just... You must like places like this. So, have you reconsidered my proposal?
What we talked about last time.
Oh, come on -- you know you really want to. You've been waiting for this opportunity ...all...your...life...

God -- so why do you come around? You don't want to help me, not that you have to. You don't want to sleep with me, not that you have to do that either. So why am I here? There's a lot of things you don't know about me. You'd be surprised how many things I could do. Take me home immediately! I want to go home. I can't stand this! I can't take this anymore! Prince! I don't need this! I was doing alright before I met you. Motherfucker, you need a haircut! I don't get this. Prince! Who do you think you are?! You don't care. You don't care about anything! I never wanted you to help me anyway!
PRINCE, I HATE YOU! I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said those things. Will you forgive me?
When?
'Cause I have to do something first.
A secret...
No.
Bye... Yes...? Come in ... Hey -- wait a minute. What's going on?
You're crazy! -- What are you doing?
I can't -- I've got things to do.
answer: C'mon, ten minutes. I want to show you something-

question: Where is everybody?
So what are you doing here?
answer: But I'm here to tell you that there's something else -- our music--.

question: What's the matter with this house? Isn't it nice and warm here?!
Shut up! Shut up!
I'm just trapped here...
answer: You always got a roof overhead...

question: You don't let me have any fun...

question: You never...
I missed you! Missed you! Missed you!
I have a big surprise for you. Da...da..!
Open it.
answer: Oh, no... Oh, no! How'd you do it? Here...

question: I love it! I'm going to join Morris' group.
I'm going to join Morris' group.
answer: I'm sorry! Oh, baby, I'm sorry! Are you alright?

question: Just...leave me alone.
answer: Please...it's just... I don't want you around this at all. I just don't want you in my life this way. You don't have to prove anything to me or anybody else. Vanity...? Don't I make you happy? Don.t you like the way we are? Do you know Morris? Do you know what he's about? He doesn't care about you.

question: Jealous..?!
What do you want?
You having trouble?
No?
Where's Lisa and Wendy? Morris called me this morning. Seems he's got himself a new group called Vanity Six. You know anything about them?
He tells me they're great. Thinks I'll be interested. That's cool, but now I've got a problem.

I book three acts -- I can't afford four. If they're as good as Morris says they are, one of you will have to go... Go around the block! It won't be The Time -- they're playing backup to Vanity. So it's either you or the Modern Aires. What would You do in my position? I like the Modern Aires. They have a good following -- they show up for practice -- and the kids like all their music. 'Nough said. Get smart. Straighten up your shit.
answer: I want to talk to you.

answer: I said I'm busy -- we'll talk later.

question: Uh, uh...
answer: Leave me alone! I've got a show to do! YOU can't just come in here and take me away! We'll talk later!

question: Jellybean, please...
Ma...what happened?

question: I'd like to see them. You got them written down somewhere?
answer: No, man -- I don't write them down -- don't need to. That's the big difference between you and me.

I don't know.
What are we doing here, Morris?
I don't want to be here. I don't want to hurt anybody.
answer: It's not about hurting anybody. This is business. We can use the exposure.

question: Your horns are showing, Morris.
answer: Yeah...but they're holding up my halo.

question: brings the SONG to a blistering end. The stage is plunged into darkness. He strips off his guitar, cuts from the stage, ignoring the grave looks from his Band Members.
answer: What the fuck's wrong with you, Prince?!

answer: My stage is no place for your personal shit!

question: That's life, man.
answer: Life my ass, motherfucker! This is a business, and you're not too far gone to see that. I've told you this before. You're not pulling them in like you used to. The only person who gives a fuck about your music is yourself.

question: Fuck off!
answer: Just like your old man... Yeah -- you got it. Tell me I'm wrong. You're not blind. Look around you. No one's digging you. Look at your band. Are they in here right now? They're out there 'cause they can't stand being in the same room with you. What a fucking waste...like father, like son--

question: Lay off that!
answer: Take your head out of your ass, Prince, check it out -- unless you like the view up there. Your music doesn't make sense to anyone but yourself.

question: Hee, hee...huh, it's obvious you don't have what it takes to be on top. But to show you that I'm sympathetic to your problems - - here's a pass to our show tomorrow night. Enjoy it. Don't forget to bring a girlfriend. Whawhak! cuts from the dressing room, closes the door behind him. He joins Jerome at the curtain, and they move down the back stairway to the CLUB-- I guess this is it.
I think I'm going to be sick. Why does this have to be happening to me? Has it crossed your mind that we're about to make the biggest mistake we've ever made?
answer: I don't think it's all that bad.

question: Did you hear these people applauding? They loved us -- they wanted to rip us apart, and this is just our first night. I can see it now, we're all going to be big stars. I can feel it.
Morris, you're a genius.
Huh, where's Jerome?
Is he coming?
answer: I gave him the night off.

question: Why?
So here we are again. So this is it, huh? What do you want this time? What's your problem now? What's your main problem?
answer: No problem. I just wanted to talk, alright? I just want us to be okay, to really get along. No big deal.

question: No big deal, huh...
No, definitely not. Who are you? You can't tell me what to do.
answer: Please don't drink that. Give it to me.

question: You're nothing, Prince, absolutely nothing. You think you're so special -- but deep down you're just like all the rest. Your whole life you've been hiding, hiding behind your music. But now you don't even have that, because last night...last night you used it to hurt someone, someone who really cares. If you put your hands on me like that ever again, I'll be the last person you touch. shoots a look at Prince, her lips trembling, her love for him, written plainly on her face. But his eyes flash defiantly. She bites her lip sadly, then snaps a hot look at the Driver-- I need a ride.
answer: Dad...? Mom...? Daddd...! sits motionless a long time. Moonlight floods the basement with a foreboding light. A dog BARKS somewhere in the distance. He looks up suddenly, his face agitated, his eyes red from tears. Noooooo!!
